mainTitle: Trump and Zelensky Meet at Pope's Funeral to Discuss Peace Efforts

dialogue.line: Did you hear about Trump meeting with Zelensky during the Pope's funeral?
Yeah, it was a historic moment. They discussed peace efforts between Ukraine and Russia.
I heard Zelensky refused to give up territory like Crimea. That's a big deal.
Right, Trump has been pushing for territorial concessions to end the war, but Zelensky isn't budging.
Why is Trump so focused on this? Isn't it risky?
He probably thinks it's the only way to broker peace. But critics say it could backfire.
What role did Macron and Starmer play in this meeting?
They were there too, acting as mediators. It was a multi-leader effort to bring them together.
It's interesting how Trump is trying to mediate despite the ongoing conflict.
Yeah, but Zelensky seems determined to hold his ground. He wants a full ceasefire first.
Do you think this meeting will lead to any real progress?
It's too early to tell, but at least they're talking. That's a start.
What about the US Democrats' reaction? Are they supporting Trump on this?
They seem skeptical. Some think Trump is overreaching his role as president.
It's a complicated situation. I wonder how it will all play out.
Me too. But at least the world is watching and hoping for peace.
